name: Auto-calibrator
description: This algorithm offers oscillator calibration, similar to that in our Silent Way Voice Controller VST plug-in, in the FH-2 module, and in various algorithms on the disting EX. Pass the pitch CV from another algorithm (e.g., Quantizer) or another module through this algorithm, and connect the output to your VCOâ€™s CV input. To perform calibration, connect an output from the VCO back into this algorithm. Set 'Start' to 'On' to begin calibration, which outputs voltages (-4V to +6V) and analyzes the pitch of the resulting signal from the VCO, drawing a graph of results. Once complete, it continuously modifies incoming pitch CVs to achieve expected frequencies on the VCO. Calibration requires a clean waveform (e.g., sine or triangle). The process calibrates the *combination* of disting NT output and VCO, accounting for physical tuning knobs, temperature, etc.
use_cases: Correcting VCO tuning drift over time
Automating oscillator calibration in modular synths
Fine-tuning pitch accuracy for stable performances
Compensating for temperature/environmental effects on oscillators
gui_description: Displays a graph of calibration results (voltage vs. frequency) during calibration mode, and shows desired VCO pitch, actual detected pitch, and correction voltage in continuous mode.

specifications.name: Channels
specifications.description: Number of bus channels processed simultaneously

input_ports.name: Pitch CV input
input_ports.description: Input bus for pitch control voltages (e.g., from Quantizer or other modules). Must be connected during operation.

input_ports.name: VCO audio feedback
input_ports.description: Audio output from VCO fed back into this algorithm during calibration. Required only during calibration unless using continuous mode.

output_ports.name: Calibrated pitch CV
output_ports.description: Output bus for calibrated pitch control voltages sent to the VCO's CV input. Uses 'Replace' output mode.

output_ports.name: VCO audio output (calibration)
output_ports.description: Audio signal generated during calibration (-4V to +6V sweep). Disconnected after calibration unless in continuous mode.
